description: Borrowed from Late Latin īrōnicus, from Ancient Greek εἰρωνικός (eirōnikós). Compare Middle French, ironique.

adjectives.description: ironic (comparative more ironic, superlative most ironic)

definitionGroups.group: (Of a situation) Characterized by or constituting (any kind of) irony.

examples: It's ironic that we are eating a sandwich in Sandwich, Massachusetts.

entries.meaning: (preceded with "being") Acting in a unserious and teasing manner.
examples: Don't take it personally. We're just being ironic.

entries.meaning: (Of a statement, action, etc.) Done in an insincere and mocking manner; satirical.
examples: You should assume that everything this guy posts is ironic.
